q: We never know the love of a parent till we become parents ourselves.
h:
“We never know the love of a parent till we become parents ourselves.” —
Henry Ward Beecher

q: Passion is energy. Feel the power that comes from focusing on what excites you.
h:
“Passion is energy. Feel the power that comes from focusing on what excites you. ” —
Oprah Winfrey

q: Humor isn't for everyone. It's only for people who want to have fun, enjoy life, and feel alive.
h:
“Humor isn't for everyone. It's only for people who want to have fun, enjoy life, and feel alive.” —
Anne Wilson Schaef

q: Opportunity comes when you continually push forward.
h:
“Opportunity comes when you continually push forward.” —
Sonia Ricotti

q: Intense love does not measure, it just gives.
h:
“Intense love does not measure, it just gives.” —
Mother Teresa

q: If you are far from the enemy, make him believe you are near.
h:
“If you are far from the enemy, make him believe you are near.” —
Sun Tzu

q: Pleasure is always derived from something outside you, whereas joy arises from within.
h:
“Pleasure is always derived from something outside you, whereas joy arises from within. ” —
Eckhart Tolle

q: You have a brain and mind of your own. Use it, and reach your own decisions.
h:
“You have a brain and mind of your own. Use it, and reach your own decisions.” —
Napoleon Hill

q: Over time, loneliness gets inside you and doesn't go away.
h:
“Over time, loneliness gets inside you and doesn't go away.” —
Carlos Ruiz Zafon

q: Not why the addiction but why the pain.
h:
“Not why the addiction but why the pain.” —
Gabor Mate

q: I alone cannot change the world, but I can cast a stone across the waters to create many ripples.
h:
“I alone cannot change the world, but I can cast a stone across the waters to create many ripples.” —
Mother Teresa

q: He who has overcome his fears will truly be free.
h:
“He who has overcome his fears will truly be free.” —
Aristotle

q: Truth is exact correspondence with reality.
h:
“Truth is exact correspondence with reality. ” —
Paramahansa Yogananda

q: Character is destiny.
h:
“Character is destiny.” —
Heraclitus

q: Zen insists that the whole trouble is just our failure to realize that there is no problem.
h:
“Zen insists that the whole trouble is just our failure to realize that there is no problem.” —
Bruce Lee

q: Every time you are tempted to react in the same old way, ask if you want to be a prisoner of the past or a pioneer of the future.
h:
“Every time you are tempted to react in the same old way, ask if you want to be a prisoner of the past or a pioneer of the future.” —
Deepak Chopra

q: Turn off your mind, relax, and float downstream.
h:
“Turn off your mind, relax, and float downstream.” —
John Lennon

q: Be polite to all, but intimate with few.
h:
“Be polite to all, but intimate with few.” —
Thomas Jefferson

q: We are always complaining that our days are few, and acting as though there would be no end of them.
h:
“We are always complaining that our days are few, and acting as though there would be no end of them. ” —
Seneca

q: Do not follow the ideas of others, but learn to listen to the voice within yourself.
h:
“Do not follow the ideas of others, but learn to listen to the voice within yourself.” —
Dogen

q: Life is too important to be taken seriously.
h:
“Life is too important to be taken seriously.” —
Oscar Wilde

q: What we call the beginning is often the end. And to make an end is to make a beginning. The end is where we start from.
h:
“What we call the beginning is often the end. And to make an end is to make a beginning. The end is where we start from.” —
T.S. Eliot

q: A scientific man ought to have no wishes, no affections, - a mere heart of stone.
h:
“A scientific man ought to have no wishes, no affections, - a mere heart of stone.” —
Charles Darwin

q: Every man's work, whether it be literature or music or pictures or architecture or anything else, is always a portrait of himself.
h:
“Every man's work, whether it be literature or music or pictures or architecture or anything else, is always a portrait of himself.” —
Samuel Butler

q: Being ignorant is not so much a shame, as being unwilling to learn.
h:
“Being ignorant is not so much a shame, as being unwilling to learn.” —
Benjamin Franklin

q: It is better to learn late than never.
h:
“It is better to learn late than never.” —
Publilius Syrus

q: Everything you've ever wanted is on the other side of fear.
h:
“Everything you've ever wanted is on the other side of fear.” —
George Addair

q: It is better to fail in originality than to succeed in imitation.
h:
“It is better to fail in originality than to succeed in imitation.” —
Herman Melville

q: A different result requires doing something different.
h:
“A different result requires doing something different.” —
Gary Keller

q: Act the way you want to be and soon you'll be the way you act.
h:
“Act the way you want to be and soon you'll be the way you act.” —
Les Brown

q: It will never rain roses: when we want to have more roses, we must plant more roses.
h:
“It will never rain roses: when we want to have more roses, we must plant more roses.” —
George Eliot

q: Common sense is not so common.
h:
“Common sense is not so common. ” —
Voltaire

q: Don't live the same year 75 times and call it a life.
h:
“Don't live the same year 75 times and call it a life.” —
Robin Sharma

q: It doesn't matter what you do, only how well you do it.
h:
“It doesn't matter what you do, only how well you do it.” —
Dan Millman

q: My guiding principle is this: Guilt is never to be doubted.
h:
“My guiding principle is this: Guilt is never to be doubted. ” —
Franz Kafka

q: It is difficult to free fools from the chains they revere.
h:
“It is difficult to free fools from the chains they revere. ” —
Voltaire

q: Nothing is easier than fault finding.
h:
“Nothing is easier than fault finding.” —
Og Mandino

q: People do not decide their futures, they decide their habits and their habits decide their futures.
h:
“People do not decide their futures, they decide their habits and their habits decide their futures.” —
Gary Keller

q: Thinking is difficult, that's why most people judge.
h:
“Thinking is difficult, that's why most people judge.” —
Carl Jung

q: The more we value things, the less we value ourselves.
h:
“The more we value things, the less we value ourselves. ” —
Bruce Lee

q: Generosity is giving more than you can, and pride is taking less than you need.
h:
“Generosity is giving more than you can, and pride is taking less than you need.” —
Kahlil Gibran

q: The purpose of life is to live it, to taste experience to the utmost, to reach out eagerly and without fear for newer and richer experience.
h:
“The purpose of life is to live it, to taste experience to the utmost, to reach out eagerly and without fear for newer and richer experience.” —
Eleanor Roosevelt

q: You're always free to change your mind and choose a different future, or a different past.
h:
“You're always free to change your mind and choose a different future, or a different past.” —
Richard Bach

q: Life does not get better by chance, it gets better by change.
h:
“Life does not get better by chance, it gets better by change.” —
Jim Rohn

q: When you are totally at peace with yourself, nothing can shake you.
h:
“When you are totally at peace with yourself, nothing can shake you.” —
Deepam Chaterjee

q: When you reach the end of your rope, tie a knot in it and hang on.
h:
“When you reach the end of your rope, tie a knot in it and hang on.” —
Franklin D. Roosevelt

q: Success is never final, failure is never fatal. It's courage that counts.
h:
“Success is never final, failure is never fatal. It's courage that counts.” —
John Wooden

q: Learn to sit back and observe, not everything needs a reaction.
h:
“Learn to sit back and observe, not everything needs a reaction.” —
Unknown

q: Every person, all the events of your life are there because you have drawn them there. What you choose to do with them is up to you.
h:
“Every person, all the events of your life are there because you have drawn them there. What you choose to do with them is up to you.” —
Richard Bach

q: When you're at the end of your rope, tie a knot and hold on.
h:
“When you're at the end of your rope, tie a knot and hold on.” —
Theodore Roosevelt
